metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 24 axioms covering thinking, causal systems, envisioned causal systems, prediction, explanation, and belief interaction with envisioning
metadata.notation: First-order logic with extensive causal system modeling and envisioning sequences

axioms.title: Definition of thinkOf
axioms.fol: (forall (a c) (iff (thinkOf a c) (exists (f) (and (focusOfAttention f a)(inm c f)))))
axioms.english: To think of some concept, entity, or eventuality is to have it in the focus of attention

axioms.title: Perception causes conscious belief
axioms.fol: (forall (a e e1) (if (and (eventuality e)(perceive' e1 a e)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (thinkThat' e2 a e)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: If we perceive an eventuality, then defeasibly this causes us to think that it holds - we are conscious of it and we believe it

axioms.title: Perception causes belief in existence
axioms.fol: (forall (a x e1) (if (and (perceive' e1 a x)(etc)) (exists (e e2) (and (Rexist' e x)(thinkThat' e2 a e)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: If we perceive anything, eventuality or not, then defeasibly this causes us to think that it really exists

axioms.title: Associations cause thinking
axioms.fol: (forall (x y a e1) (if (and (associated x y a)(thinkOf' e1 a x)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (thinkOf' e2 a y)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: If two entities are associated for an agent, then thinking of one will defeasibly cause the agent to think of the other

axioms.title: Definition of predict
axioms.fol: (forall (a e e1) (iff (predict' e1 a e) (exists (t1 e2 t2 e3) (and (atTime e1 t1)(atTime' e2 e t2) (not (before t2 t1)) (thinkThat' e3 a e2)(gen e3 e1)))))
axioms.english: To predict an eventuality is to believe it will occur at some time that is not before the time of the prediction

axioms.title: Causal belief enables prediction
axioms.fol: (forall (x y a e e1 e2 e3) (if (and (cause' e e1 e2)(thinkThat a e)(thinkThat' e3 a e1) (etc)) (exists (e4) (and (predict' e4 a e2)(cause e3 e4)))))
axioms.english: If an agent believes in a causal relation and thinks that the cause holds, then defeasibly the agent will predict the effect

axioms.title: Definition of validated prediction
axioms.fol: (forall (a e e1 t1) (if (and (predict' e1 a e)(atTime e1 t1)) (iff (validated e1) (exists (t2) (and (atTime e t2)(not (before t2 t1)))))))
axioms.english: If a predicted eventuality actually happens at some future time, then the prediction is validated

axioms.title: Definition of invalidated prediction
axioms.fol: (forall (a e e1 t1) (if (and (predict' e1 a e)(atTime e1 t1)) (iff (invalidated e1) (forall (t2) (if (not (before t2 t1))(not (atTime e t2)))))))
axioms.english: If a predicted eventuality does not happen at some future time, the prediction is invalidated

axioms.title: Definition of explain
axioms.fol: (forall (a e e1) (iff (explain a e e1) (exists (e2) (and (thinkThat a e2)(cause' e2 e1 e)))))
axioms.english: To explain an eventuality is to think that some specific eventuality caused it

axioms.title: Alternative causes create disjunctive thinking
axioms.fol: (forall (a e e1 e2 e3 e4 e5) (if (and (believe a e3)(cause' e3 e1 e) (believe a e4)(cause' e4 e2 e)(thinkOf' e5 a e)(etc)) (exists (e6 e7) (and (thinkOf' e6 a e7)(or' e7 e1 e2)(cause e5 e6)))))
axioms.english: If agent a believes e1 can cause e and e2 can cause e, and a thinks of e, then that will defeasibly cause a to think of the disjunction of e1 and e2

axioms.title: Alternative effects create disjunctive thinking
axioms.fol: (forall (a e e1 e2 e3 e4 e5) (if (and (believe a e3)(causallyInvolved' e3 e e1) (believe a e4)(causallyInvolved' e4 e e2) (thinkOf' e5 a e)(etc)) (exists (e6 e7) (and (thinkOf' e6 a e7)(or' e7 e1 e2)(cause e5 e6)))))
axioms.english: If the agent believes that an eventuality e could be a partial cause for eventuality e1 or could be a partial cause of eventuality e2, this defeasibly will cause the agent to think of the disjunction of e1 and e2

axioms.title: Definition of branch
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e2 s) (iff (branch e e1 e2 s) (and (member e s)(member e1 s)(member e2 s) (or (or' e e1 e2)(or' e e2 e1)))))
axioms.english: e is a branch to e1 and e2 in s exactly when e, e1 and e2 are all members of s and e is a disjunction of e1 and e2

axioms.title: Branch symmetry
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e2 s) (iff (branch e e1 e2 s)(branch e e2 e1 s)))
axioms.english: Branch is symmetric in its middle two arguments

axioms.title: Reified disjunction
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e2) (iff (or' e e1 e2) (exists (e3 e4) (and (disjunct' e3 e1 e)(disjunct' e4 e2 e)))))
axioms.english: Reify the disjunct relation, so it can function as an arc in a graph

axioms.title: Definition of causal system arc
axioms.fol: (forall (r e1 e2 s) (if (eventualities s) (iff (csArc r e1 e2 s) (or (and (causallyInvolved' r e1 e2) (member e1 s)(member e2 s)) (exists (e3) (and (member e1 s)(member e2 s)(member e3 s) (branch e1 e2 e3 s) (disjunct' r e2 e1)))))))
axioms.english: A causal system arc is either a causally involved relation or a relation between a disjunction and one of its disjuncts

axioms.title: Definition of causal system
axioms.fol: (forall (c) (iff (causalSystem c) (exists (v s) (and (componentsOf v c)(relationsOf s c) (eventualities v) (forall (r) (if (member r s) (exists (e1 e2) (csArc r e1 e2 v))))))))
axioms.english: A causal system is a composite entity whose components are eventualities and whose relations are causal system arcs among them

axioms.title: Eventualities of causal system
axioms.fol: (forall (c v) (if (causalSystem c) (iff (eventualitiesOf v c) (componentsOf v c))))
axioms.english: The components of a causal system are its eventualities

axioms.title: CsArc with causal systems
axioms.fol: (forall (r e1 e2 c) (if (causalSystem c) (iff (csArc r e1 e2 c) (exists (v) (and (eventualitiesOf v c)(csArc r e1 e2 v))))))
axioms.english: Allow csArc to take causal systems as its fourth argument as well as sets of eventualities

axioms.title: Definition of causally linked
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2 c) (iff (causallyLinked e1 e2 c) (exists (r v s) (and (eventualitiesOf v c)(relationsOf s c) (member r s) (or (csArc r e1 e2 c)(csArc r e2 e1 c) (exists (e3 c0 s0) (and (or (csArc' r e1 e3 c) (csArc' r e3 e1 c)) (deleteElt s0 s r) (causalSystem c0) (eventualitiesOf v c0) (relationsOf s0 c0) (causallyLinked e3 e2 c0))))))))
axioms.english: Two eventualities e1 and e2 are causally linked in a causal system c if there is a chain of csArc relations in c between e1 and e2, regardless of direction

axioms.title: Definition of connected subsystem
axioms.fol: (forall (c1 e c) (iff (connSubCS c1 e c) (exists (v1 v) (and (eventualitiesOf v c)(eventualitiesOf v1 c1) (member e v)(member e v1) (forall (e1) (iff (member e1 v1) (and (member e1 v) (or (equal e1 e) (causallyLinked e e1 c)))))))))
axioms.english: A connected subsystem c1 of a causal system c contains eventuality e and all eventualities causally linked to e

axioms.title: Definition of connected causal system
axioms.fol: (forall (c) (iff (connectedCausalSystem c) (exists (v s) (and (causalSystem c)(eventualitiesOf v c) (relationsOf s c) (forall (e1 e2) (if (and (member e1 v)(member e2 v)) (causallyLinked e1 e2 c)))))))
axioms.english: A connected causal system is a causal system in which all eventualities are causally linked by relations in the causal system

axioms.title: Definition of branchless causal system
axioms.fol: (forall (c) (iff (branchlessCausalSystem c) (exists (s1 s2) (and (causalSystem c)(eventualitiesOf v c) (relationsOf s c) (forall (r) (if (member r s) (exists (e1 e2) (and (member e1 v)(member e2 v) (causallyInvolved' r e1 e2)))))))))
axioms.english: A branchless causal system is a causal system all of whose arcs are causallyInvolved relations, rather than disjunctions

axioms.title: Definition of isolated node
axioms.fol: (forall (e c) (iff (isolated e c) (exists (v) (and (eventualitiesOf v c)(member e v) (not (exists (r e1) (or (csArc r e1 e c)(csArc r e e1 c))))))))
axioms.english: A node e is isolated with respect to a causal system c if there are no arcs into it and no arcs out of it

axioms.title: Definition of eventuality in causal system
axioms.fol: (forall (e c) (iff (eventualityIn e c) (exists (v) (and (eventualitiesOf v c)(member e v)))))
axioms.english: The members of the eventualities of a causal system are the eventualities in it

axioms.title: Definition of oneArcDiff
axioms.fol: (forall (c e1 r e2 c0) (iff (oneArcDiff c e1 r e2 c0) (exists (v0 s0 v s d) (and (causalSystem c0)(causalSystem c) (eventualitiesOf v0 s0)(relationsOf s0 c0) (eventualitiesOf v c)(relationsOf s c) (union v v0 d)(doubleton d e1 e2) (causallyInvolved' r e1 e2)(not (member r s0)) (addElt s s0 r)))))
axioms.english: The two causal systems c and c0 differ by only one arc, the arc r from e1 to e2

axioms.title: Definition of delCSRel
axioms.fol: (forall (c2 c0 d) (iff (delCSRel c2 c0 d) (exists (v0 s0 s2) (and (eventualitiesOf v0 c0)(relationsOf s0 c0) (eventualitiesOf v0 c2)(relationsOf s2 c2) (deleteElt s2 s0 d)))))
axioms.english: Causal system c2 results from deleting the relation d from causal system c0

axioms.title: Definition of resolveBranch (part 1)
axioms.fol: (forall (c e0 e1 e2 c0) (iff (resolveBranch c e0 e1 e2 c0) (exists (d c2 c1 v0 v v1) (and (causalSystem c0)(causalSystem c) (eventualitiesOf v0 c0)(eventualitiesOf v c) (branch e0 e1 e2 v0)(disjunct' d e2 e0) (delCSRel c2 c0 d)(connSubCS c1 e2 c2) (or (and (causallyLinked e1 e2 c2)(null v1)) (and (not (causallyLinked e1 e2 c2)) (eventualitiesOf v1 c1)))
axioms.english: Complex branch resolution operation that eliminates e0 and resets arcs from e0 to e1, potentially eliminating disconnected subsystems

axioms.title: Definition of contiguous causal systems
axioms.fol: (forall (c1 c2) (iff (contigCS c1 c2) (or (exists (e1 r e2) (or (oneArcDiff c1 e1 r e2 c2) (oneArcDiff c2 e1 r e2 c1))) (exists (e0 e1 e2) (or (resolveBranch c1 e0 e1 e2 c2) (resolveBranch c2 e0 e1 e2 c1))))))
axioms.english: Two causal systems are contiguous if they stand in oneArcDiff or resolveBranch relation

axioms.title: Contiguity symmetry
axioms.fol: (forall (c1 c2) (iff (contigCS c1 c2)(contigCS c2 c1)))
axioms.english: The contigCS relation is obviously symmetric

axioms.title: Definition of envisioned causal system
axioms.fol: (forall (c a) (iff (ecs c a) (exists (v s) (and (causalSystem c)(eventualitiesOf v c) (relationsOf s c) (forall (e) (if (member e v)(thinkOf a e))) (forall (r) (if (member r s) (or (thinkOf a r)(believe a r))))))))
axioms.english: Agent a envisions causal system c if a is thinking of every eventuality in c and either thinking of or believing every causal relation in c

axioms.title: Definition of background beliefs
axioms.fol: (forall (b a c) (if (ecs c a) (iff (backgroundBeliefs b a) (exists (v s) (and (eventualitiesOf v c)(relationsOf s c) (forall (e1 e2) (if (and (member e1 b)(not' e2 e1)) (not (member e2 v)))) (forall (r e1 e2 e3) (if (and (causallyInvolved' r e1 e2) (not' e3 r)(member e3 b)) (not (member r s)))))))))
axioms.english: Background beliefs are beliefs that are never challenged - negations of background beliefs are never in the envisioned causal system

axioms.title: Definition of envisioned causal system sequence
axioms.fol: (forall (s a) (iff (ecsSeq s a) (and (sequence s) (forall (c1) (if (inSeq c1 s)(ecs c1 a))) (forall (n n1 l c1 c2) (if (and (gt n 0)(length l s)(lt n l) (successor n1 n) (nth c1 n s)(nth c2 n1 s)) (contigCS c1 c2))) (exists (s0) (and (sequence s0) (forall (e1 n) (iff (nth e1 n s0) (exists (c1) (and (nth c1 n s) (ecs' e1 c1 a))))) (forall (n n1 l e1 e2) (if (and (gt n 0)(length l s0)(lt n l) (successor n1 n) (nth e1 n s0)(nth e2 n1 s0)) (change e1 e2))))))))
axioms.english: An envisioned causal system sequence is a sequence of contiguous envisioned causal systems with corresponding change states

axioms.title: Definition of envisioned eventuality
axioms.fol: (forall (e s a) (iff (envisionedEv e s a) (exists (c) (and (ecsSeq s a)(inSeq c s)(eventualityIn e c)))))
axioms.english: An eventuality in any element of an envisioned causal system sequence is an envisioned eventuality

axioms.title: Definition of envisionFromTo
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1 e2) (iff (envisionFromTo a e1 e2) (exists (s) (and (ecsSeq s a)(first e1 s)(last e2 s)))))
axioms.english: Envisioning a sequence from one causal system to another

axioms.title: Definition of envisionFrom
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1) (iff (envisionFrom a e1) (exists (e2) (envisionFromTo a e1 e2))))
axioms.english: Envisioning from a starting causal system

axioms.title: Definition of envisionTo
axioms.fol: (forall (a e2) (iff (envisionTo a e2) (exists (e1) (envisionFromTo a e1 e2))))
axioms.english: Envisioning to an ending causal system

axioms.title: People can envision
axioms.fol: (forall (a) (if (person a) (exists (s e1 c) (and (ecsSeq' e1 s a)(able a e1 c)))))
axioms.english: People have an ability to envision causal system sequences

axioms.title: Definition of thinkAbout
axioms.fol: (forall (s a) (if (and (ecsSeq s a) (forall (c v) (if (and (inSeq c s)(eventualitiesOf v c)) (exists (e) (and (member e v)(arg* x e)))))) (thinkAbout a x)))
axioms.english: If every element of an ecsSeq includes a property of x among its eventualities, then the agent is thinking about x

axioms.title: Belief in causal systems
axioms.fol: (forall (a c v s) (if (and (causalSystem c) (eventualitiesOf v c)(relationsOf s c)) (iff (believe a c) (and (believe a v)(believe a s)))))
axioms.english: To believe a causal system is to believe the conjunction of the set of eventualities and the set of causallyInvolved relations that characterize the causal system

axioms.title: Real-world envisionments
axioms.fol: (forall (a) (if (person a) (exists (s t) (and (ecsSeq s a)(during s t)))))
axioms.english: Some envisionments are about events and states that happen in the real world at a particular time

axioms.title: Fictional envisionments
axioms.fol: (forall (a) (if (person a) (exists (s) (and (ecsSeq s a) (forall (t) (not (during s t)))))))
axioms.english: Some envisionments are about fictional worlds, as in fiction and dreams, and have never happened and never will

axioms.title: Definition of changeGBel
axioms.fol: (forall (a e d1 d2) (iff (changeGBel a e d1 d2) (exists (e1 e2) (and (gbel' e1 a e d1)(gbel' e2 a e d2) (nequal d1 d2)(change e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: A predicate expressing a change in degree of graded belief - agent a's belief in e changes from d1 to d2

axioms.title: Decreasing element belief decreases system belief
axioms.fol: (forall (a e d1 d2 c v) (if (and (ecs c a)(eventualitiesOf v c)(member e v) (changeGBel a e d1 d2)(gt d1 d2)(etc)) (exists (d3 d4) (and (changeGBel a c d3 d4)(gt d3 d4)))))
axioms.english: Defeasibly decreasing the belief in an element of a causal system causes a decrease in the belief in the causal system as a whole

axioms.title: Increasing element belief increases system belief
axioms.fol: (forall (a e d1 d2 c v) (if (and (ecs c a)(eventualitiesOf v c)(member e v) (changeGBel a e d1 d2)(lt d1 d2)(etc)) (exists (d3 d4) (and (changeGBel a c d3 d4)(lt d3 d4)))))
axioms.english: Defeasibly increasing the belief in an element of a causal system causes an increase in the belief in the causal system as a whole

axioms.title: Increasing relation belief increases system belief
axioms.fol: (forall (a r d1 d2 c s) (if (and (ecs c a)(relationsOf s c)(member r s) (changeGBel a r d1 d2)(gt d1 d2)(etc)) (exists (d3 d4) (and (changeGBel a c d3 d4)(gt d3 d4)))))
axioms.english: Defeasibly increasing the belief in a relation of a causal system causes an increase in the belief in the causal system as a whole

axioms.title: Decreasing relation belief decreases system belief
axioms.fol: (forall (a e d1 d2 c s) (if (and (ecs c a)(relationsOf s c)(member r s) (changeGBel a e d1 d2)(lt d1 d2)(etc)) (exists (d3 d4) (and (changeGBel a c d3 d4)(lt d3 d4)))))
axioms.english: Defeasibly decreasing the belief in a relation of a causal system causes a decrease in the belief in the causal system as a whole

axioms.title: Finding believed cause increases system belief
axioms.fol: (forall (a c c0 e1 e2 r e3 e4 v0) (if (and (ecs' e3 c0 a)(ecs' e4 c a) (oneArcDiff c e1 r e2 c0) (eventualitiesOf v0 c0)(not (member e1 v0)) (believe a e1)(change' e0 e3 e4)(etc)) (exists (e) (and (changeGBel' e a c0 d1 d2)(gt d2 d1) (cause e0 e)))))
axioms.english: If an agent changes from entertaining causal system c0 to entertaining causal system c, where c includes a new possible cause that is already believed, this defeasibly causes an increase in belief in the original causal system

axioms.title: Finding believed effect increases system belief
axioms.fol: (forall (a c c0 e1 e2 r e3 e4 v0) (if (and (ecs' e3 c0 a)(ecs' e4 c a) (oneArcDiff c e1 r e2 c0)(member e1 v0) (eventualitiesOf v0 c0)(not (member e2 v0)) (believe a e2)(change' e0 e3 e4)(etc)) (exists (e) (and (changeGBel' e a c0 d1 d2)(gt d2 d1) (cause e0 e)))))
axioms.english: There is a change in which the agent thinks of a new possible effect and already believes that to be true. This causes the agent's belief in the original causal system to increase

axioms.title: Falsified prediction decreases system belief
axioms.fol: (forall (a c c0 e1 e2 r e3 e4 v0) (if (and (ecs' e3 c0 a)(ecs' e4 c a) (oneArcDiff c e1 r e2 c0)(eventualitiesOf v0 c0) (member e1 v0)(not (member e2 v0)) (not' e5 e2)(believe a e5) (change' e0 e3 e4)(etc)) (exists (e) (and (changeGBel' e a c0 d1 d2)(lt d2 d1) (cause e0 e)))))
axioms.english: Predictions can be falsified, and this decreases the degree of belief in the original causal system

axioms.title: False branch element increases other disjunct belief
axioms.fol: (forall (c c0 c1 c2 v1 e0 e1 e2 e3 e4 e5 e6 e7 d) (if (and (ecs' e3 c0 a)(ecs' e4 c a) (resolveBranch c e0 e1 e2 c0) (disjunct' d e2 e0)(delCSRel c2 c0 d) (connSubCS c1 e2 c2)(eventualitiesOf v1 c1) (member e5 v1)(not' e6 e5)(believe a e6) (change' e7 e3 e4)(etc)) (exists (e) (and (changeGBel' e a c d1 d2)(gt d2 d1) (cause e7 e)))))
axioms.english: If a causal system has a branch and a false proposition is found in the connected subsystem of one of the disjuncts, then defeasibly there is an increased graded belief in the causal system with that branch resolved to the other disjunct

axioms.title: Definition of current world understanding (time-dependent)
axioms.fol: (forall (a c t) (iff (cwu0 c a t) (exists (e1 v) (and (ecs' e1 c a)(atTime e1 t) (eventualitiesOf v c) (forall (e2) (if (and (eventuality e2) (perceive' e3 a e2)(atTime e3 t)) (member e2 v)))))))
axioms.english: If the causal system includes all the eventualities that the agent perceives and the causal system is believed, then the envisioned causal system is the agent's current world understanding at time t

axioms.title: Definition of current world understanding
axioms.fol: (forall (c a) (iff (cwu c a)(exists (t) (and (cwu0 c a t)(Now t)))))
axioms.english: A two-argument version of current world understanding by stipulating that t is Now

conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Extensive use of primed predicates for mental operations: thinkOf', thinkThat', perceive', predict', cause', ecs', csArc', disjunct', causallyInvolved', gbel', changeGBel', not', change', atTime', Rexist'
conversion_notes.defeasible_reasoning: 14 axioms use (etc) condition for defeasible reasoning in perception, association, prediction, belief change, and causal system updates
conversion_notes.causal_system_theory: Sophisticated formal framework for causal systems as directed AND-OR graphs with eventualities as nodes and causal relations as arcs
conversion_notes.envisioning_sequences: Complex theory of envisioned causal system sequences with contiguity relations and state changes
conversion_notes.belief_interaction: Detailed framework for how graded beliefs interact with envisioning through validation, falsification, and evidence incorporation
conversion_notes.cross_references: References concepts from memory (Ch 23), belief (Ch 21), causality (Ch 15), scales (Ch 12), and goals for background beliefs and abilities

file_format_notes.axiom_extraction: All 52 numbered axioms (24.1-24.52) extracted from PDF with careful attention to complex nested FOL expressions
file_format_notes.fol_formatting: FOL expressions maintain exact logical structure including complex quantifier nesting, especially in causal system definitions
file_format_notes.complexity_classification: Based on quantifier depth, logical structure complexity, and conceptual sophistication - many complex axioms due to causal system modeling
file_format_notes.pattern_identification: Patterns categorized by logical structure and theoretical role, with special attention to causal system operations and envisioning processes
